result.execSummary:
The defendant Cesar Bravo-Lozoya was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant granted a payment plan of $125.00 per month to begin 09/10/2015

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Cesar Bravo-Lozoya, appeared with Attorney John T. Stichert.    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.    The defense waived reading of the complaint and stood mute to the charges.    BASED ON THE DEFENDANT STANDING MUTE,THE COURT ENTERED A NOT GUILTY PLEA ON BEHALF OF THE DEFENDANT  Status conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Pre-trial conference at 05-14-2015 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference at 04-13-2015 10:00 am.

The defendant shall have no contact with B.M.G. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Exception defendant may be in tavern for work purposes only, must maintain absolute sobriety.

Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant, Cesar Bravo-Lozoya appeared, pro se  Susan Rascon sworn as interpreter.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 11:00 am.
